data.v: मम रामः सखा वत्से प्रीतियुक्तः सुहृच्च मे । जमदग्निसुतो वीरः सर्वशस्त्रभृतां वरः ॥
data.md: Rama is my friend, child, and he is my well-wisher and is highly pleased with me that hero, the son Jamadagni and the foremost of all wielders of weapons.

data.v: एवं ब्रुवति कन्यां तु पार्थिवे होत्रवाहने । अकृतव्रणः प्रादुरासीद्रामस्यानुचरः प्रियः ॥
data.md: While Hotravahana that ruler of the earth was thus speaking to that girl, the devoted follower of Rama, Akritavrana, presented himself there.

data.v: ततस्ते मुनयः सर्वे समुत्तस्थुः सहस्रशः । स च राजा वयोवृद्धः सृञ्जयो होत्रवाहनः ॥
data.md: Then did all those Rishis by thousands as also Hotravahana, the king of the Srinjayas, old in years, stand up.

data.v: ततः पृष्ट्वा यथान्यायमन्योन्यं ते वनौकसः । सहिता भरतश्रेष्ठ निषेदुः परिवार्य तम् ॥
data.md: Seeing him those dwellers of the forest united together did him the rites of hospitality and then sat down surrounding him, O chief among the Bharatas.

data.v: ततस्ते कथयामासुः कथास्तास्ता मनोरमाः । कान्ता दिव्याश्च राजेन्द्र प्रीतिहर्षमुदा युताः ॥
data.md: Then they began to converse cheerfully and delightfully on subjects that delighted one's heart and which were blessed and divine, O chief among kings.

data.v: ततः कथान्ते राजर्षिर्महात्मा होत्रवाहनः । रामं श्रेष्ठं महर्षीणामपृच्छदकृतव्रणम् ॥
data.md: Then at the end of the conversation, the royal sage Hotravahana, endued with a large soul, asked Akritavrana about Rama the foremost among the great Rishis.

data.v: क्व संप्रति महाबाहो जामदग्न्यः प्रतापवान् । अकृतव्रण शक्यो वै द्रष्टुं वेदविदां वरः ॥
data.md: “Where can I see at present the mighty son of Jamadagni, O you of long arms, 0 Akritavrana, that foremost among those conversant with the Vedas.

data.v: भवन्तमेव सततं रामः कीर्तयति प्रभो । सृञ्जयो मे प्रियसखो राजर्षिरिति पार्थिव ॥
data.md: Akritavrana said Rama ever speaks of you, my lord, saying: The royal sage Srinjaya, that ruler of the earth, is my dear friend.

data.v: इह रामः प्रभाते श्वो भवितेति मतिर्मम । द्रष्टास्येनमिहायान्तं तव दर्शनकाङ्क्षया ॥
data.md: I think Rama will be here on the morrow. You will see him come here owing to your desire for seeing him.

data.v: इयं च कन्या राजर्षे किमर्थं वनमागता । कस्य चेयं तव च का भवतीच्छामि वेदितुम् ॥
data.md: O royal sage, why is the lady come to the forest, whose daughter is she and what is she to you? I desire to know it.

data.v: दौहित्रीयं मम विभो काशिराजसुता शुभा । ज्येष्ठा स्वयंवरे तस्थौ भगिनीभ्यां सहानघ ॥
data.md: Hotravahana said She is my grand child, my lord, the beloved daughter of the king of the Kashis. O sinless one, she was desirous of choosing her own husband along with her two sisters.

data.v: इयमम्बेति विख्याता ज्येष्ठा काशिपतेः सुता । अम्बिकाम्बालिके त्वन्ये यवीयस्यौ तपोधन ॥
data.md: This eldest daughter of the ruler of the Kashis is known as Amba and, O you whose only wealth is devotion, his two younger daughters are called Ambika and Ambalika.

data.v: समेतं पार्थिवं क्षत्रं काशिपुर्यां ततोऽभवत् । कन्यानिमित्तं ब्रह्मर्षे तत्रासीदुत्सवो महान् ॥
data.md: Then was there assembled in the city of Kashi, the entire body of Kshatriya rulers of the earth and there were great rejoicing there, O regenerate Rishi of those princes.

data.v: ततः किल महावीर्यो भीष्मः शांतनवो नृपान् । अवाक्षिप्य महातेजास्तिस्रः कन्या जहार ताः ॥
data.md: Then did Bhishma, the son of Shantanu, endued with great heroism and energy overthrowing all those rulers of the earth, take away the three girls by force.

data.v: निर्जित्य पृथिवीपालानथ भीष्मो गजाह्वयम् । आजगाम विशुद्धात्मा कन्याभिः सह भारत ॥
data.md: Bhishma of sinless soul, having conquered those rulers of the earth came to the city called after the elephant in company with those girls, OBharata.

data.v: सत्यवत्यै निवेद्याथ विवाहार्थमनन्तरम् । भ्रातुर्विचित्रवीर्यस्य समाज्ञापयत प्रभुः ॥
data.md: That lord after submitting the case to Satyavati ordered for the wedding of his brother Vichitravirya.

data.v: ततो वैवाहिकं दृष्ट्वा कन्येयं समुपार्जितम् । अब्रवीत्तत्र गाङ्गेयं मन्त्रिमध्ये द्विजर्षभ ॥
data.md: This girl, seeing all the arrangements made for the wedding, said there to the son of Ganga in the midst of his councillors, O best among the twice-born.

data.v: मया शाल्वपतिर्वीर मनसाभिवृतः पतिः । न मामर्हसि धर्मज्ञ परचित्तां प्रदापितुम् ॥
data.md: The heroic king of Shalva has been chosen by me as my husband; O you conversant with virtue, it is not proper that you should give me, who am desirous of another, up in your brother.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं भीष्मः संमन्त्र्य सह मन्त्रिभिः । निश्चित्य विससर्जेमां सत्यवत्या मते स्थितः ॥
data.md: Bhishma, hearing those words and consulting with his ministers, came to a decision and following the opinion of Satyavati sent her away,

data.v: अनुज्ञाता तु भीष्मेण शाल्वं सौभपतिं ततः । कन्येयं मुदिता विप्र काले वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Permitted by Bhishma this girl rejoicing went to Shalva the lord of Saubha in due time and said these words:

data.v: विसर्जितास्मि भीष्मेण धर्मं मां प्रतिपादय । मनसाभिवृतः पूर्वं मया त्वं पार्थिवर्षभ ॥
data.md: I have been dismissed by Bhishma; act righteously towards me for you had before been chosen by me as my husband, O best among the rulers of the earth.

data.v: प्रत्याचख्यौ च शाल्वोऽपि चारित्रस्याभिशङ्कितः । सेयं तपोवनं प्राप्ता तापस्येऽभिरता भृशम् ॥
data.md: Shalva, however being suspicious about her character, rejected her and she, coming to this hermitage, has become greatly bent on practicing asceticism.

data.v: मया च प्रत्यभिज्ञाता वंशस्य परिकीर्तनात् । अस्य दुःखस्य चोत्पत्तिं भीष्ममेवेह मन्यते ॥
data.md: She was recognized by me owing to her describing her parentage and she thinks Bhishma as the origin of this calamity of hers.

data.v: भगवन्नेवमेवैतद्यथाह पृथिवीपतिः । शरीरकर्ता मातुर्मे सृञ्जयो होत्रवाहनः ॥
data.md: Amba said O lord, it is even as this ruler of the earth has said; the progenitor of my mother's self is this Hotravahana of the Srinjaya race.

data.v: न ह्युत्सहे स्वनगरं प्रतियातुं तपोधन । अवमानभयाच्चैव व्रीडया च महामुने ॥
data.md: I do not desire to go back to my father's city, O you whose wealth consists in asceticism, from fear of disgrace and out of shame, O great Muni.

data.v: यत्तु मां भगवान्रामो वक्ष्यति द्विजसत्तम । तन्मे कार्यतमं कार्यमिति मे भगवन्मतिः ॥
data.md: 0 best among the twice-born, it is my opinion that what the lord Rama points out to me would be my supreme duty, my lord.

data.v: दुःखद्वयमिदं भद्रे कतरस्य चिकीर्षसि । प्रतिकर्तव्यमबले तत्त्वं वत्से ब्रवीहि मे ॥
data.md: Akritavrana said For which of these two sorrows do you desire a remedy, O lady. Tell me that truly, 0 child.

data.v: यदि सौभपतिर्भद्रे नियोक्तव्यो मते तव । नियोक्ष्यति महात्मा तं रामस्त्वद्धितकाम्यया ॥
data.md: If in your opinion gentle lady, the lord of the Suabhas should be urged, the great-souled Rama, desirous of your good, will urge him.

data.v: अथापगेयं भीष्मं तं रामेणेच्छसि धीमता । रणे विनिर्जितं द्रष्टुं कुर्यात्तदपि भार्गवः ॥
data.md: Or if you desire to see the blamable Bhishma vanquished in battle by the wise Rama, he, of Bhrigu's family, will do that too.

data.v: सृञ्जयस्य वचः श्रुत्वा तव चैव शुचिस्मिते । यदत्रानन्तरं कार्यं तदद्यैव विचिन्त्यताम् ॥
data.md: Hearing the words of Srinjaya, and of yours, O you of beautiful smiles, let what ought to be done this very day be settled.

data.v: अपनीतास्मि भीष्मेण भगवन्नविजानता । न हि जानाति मे भीष्मो ब्रह्मञ्शाल्वगतं मनः ॥
data.md: Amba said Led away I had been by Bhishma, but he knew not the true state of my feelings. Bhishma did not know, O Brahmana, that my mind learned towards Shalva.

data.v: एतद्विचार्य मनसा भवानेव विनिश्चयम् । विचिनोतु यथान्यायं विधानं क्रियतां तथा ॥
data.md: Thinking of this in your mind you should settle about this; do what you think is just.

data.v: भीष्मे वा कुरुशार्दूले शाल्वराजेऽथ वा पुनः । उभयोरेव वा ब्रह्मन्यद्युक्तं तत्समाचर ॥
data.md: Do that wish is just and reasonable towards that best among the Kurus and to the king Shalva or to both.

data.v: निवेदितं मया ह्येतद्दुःखमूलं यथातथम् । विधानं तत्र भगवन्कर्तुमर्हसि युक्तितः ॥
data.md: The root of my distress, as it is, had now been submitted by me and it is proper that you should do in this matte what is reasonable.

data.v: उपपन्नमिदं भद्रे यदेवं वरवर्णिनि । धर्मं प्रति वचो ब्रूयाः शृणु चेदं वचो मम ॥
data.md: Akritavrana said It is indeed praiseworthy, gentle lady, that you are speaking these words with your eye towards virtue, O you of fair complexion; listen to these words of mine.

data.v: यदि त्वामापगेयो वै न नयेद्गजसाह्वयम् । शाल्वस्त्वां शिरसा भीरु गृह्णीयाद्रामचोदितः ॥
data.md: If the blamable one had not led you to the city called after the elephant, Shalva would have accepted you, O timid lady, with his head bowed down, urged by Rama.

data.v: तेन त्वं निर्जिता भद्रे यस्मान्नीतासि भामिनि । संशयः शाल्वराजस्य तेन त्वयि सुमध्यमे ॥
data.md: But since you, gentle lady, had been taken away by him after gaining a victory, O romantic lady, the king Shalva has therefore doubts in you, o you of beautiful waist.

data.v: भीष्मः पुरुषमानी च जितकाशी तथैव च । तस्मात्प्रतिक्रिया युक्ता भीष्मे कारयितुं त्वया ॥
data.md: Bhishma is proud of his bravery and success and therefore it stands to reason that your remedy lies in Bhishma.

data.v: ममाप्येष महान्ब्रह्मन्हृदि कामोऽभिवर्तते । घातयेयं यदि रणे भीष्ममित्येव नित्यदा ॥
data.md: Amba said This desire has ever obtained in my heart. O Brahmana, that I would have but Bhishma slain in battle.

data.v: भीष्मं वा शाल्वराजं वा यं वा दोषेण गच्छसि । प्रशाधि तं महाबाहो यत्कृतेऽहं सुदुःखिता ॥
data.md: Whoever is blamable, Bhishma to the king of the Shalvas, punish him who has brought about this great distress, O you of long arms.

data.v: एवं कथयतामेव तेषां स दिवसो गतः । रात्रिश्च भरतश्रेष्ठ सुखशीतोष्णमारुता ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The day passed away while they were conversing on this as also the night which was marked by pleasant breezes that were neither too hot nor too cold, O chief among the Bharatas.

data.v: ततो रामः प्रादुरासीत्प्रज्वलन्निव तेजसा । शिष्यैः परिवृतो राजञ्जटाचीरधरो मुनिः ॥
data.md: Then did Rama come there as if blazing with energy, the anchorite having matted hairs wearing deer skin was surrounded by his disciples.

data.v: धनुष्पाणिरदीनात्मा खड्गं बिभ्रत्परश्वधी । विरजा राजशार्दूल सोऽभ्ययात्सृञ्जयं नृपम् ॥
data.md: The great-souled one came, bow in hand, and holding a sword and battle-axe; and the sinless one approached that ruler of men, Srinjaya, O best among kings.

data.v: ततस्तं तापसा दृष्ट्वा स च राजा महातपाः । तस्थुः प्राञ्जलयः सर्वे सा च कन्या तपस्विनी ॥
data.md: Seeing him the ascetics and the king of great asceticism stood up with clasped hands; so also did that girl.

data.v: पूजयामासुरव्यग्रा मधुपर्केण भार्गवम् । अर्चितश्च यथायोगं निषसाद सहैव तैः ॥
data.md: Earnestly they adored him of the Bhrigu race, with honey and curds and being duly honored he sat down with them.

data.v: ततः पूर्वव्यतीतानि कथयेते स्म तावुभौ । सृञ्जयश्च स राजर्षिर्जामदग्न्यश्च भारत ॥
data.md: Then the two Srinjaya and the son of Jamadagna, sat together conversing on past matters.

data.v: ततः कथान्ते राजर्षिर्भृगुश्रेष्ठं महाबलम् । उवाच मधुरं काले रामं वचनमर्थवत् ॥
data.md: At the end of their discourse, the royal sage in proper time said these sweet words pregnant with meaning to Rama, the foremost in the race of Bhrigu, endued with great strength.

data.v: रामेयं मम दौहित्री काशिराजसुता प्रभो । अस्याः शृणु यथातत्त्वं कार्यं कार्यविशारद ॥
data.md: O Rama this is my grand daughter, the daughter of the king of the Kashis, my lord; hear what she has to say and settle what can be done for her, O you skillful in deeds.

data.v: परमं कथ्यतां चेति तां रामः प्रत्यभाषत । ततः साभ्यगमद्रामं ज्वलन्तमिव पावकम् ॥
data.md: Rama said to her, “Repeat your grand story"; thereupon she said to Rama who was blazing like fire.

data.v: सा चाभिवाद्य चरणौ रामस्य शिरसा शुभा । स्पृष्ट्वा पद्मदलाभाभ्यां पाणिभ्यामग्रतः स्थिता ॥
data.md: Saluting the holy feet of Rama with her head she touched them with her lotus like hands and stood in front of him.

data.v: रुरोद सा शोकवती बाष्पव्याकुललोचना । प्रपेदे शरणं चैव शरण्यं भृगुनन्दनम् ॥
data.md: Being stricken with grief she wept aloud and with her eyes bathed in tears she betook herself to the refuge of the delighter of Bhrigu's race who was of a worthy refuge.

data.v: यथासि सृञ्जयस्यास्य तथा मम नृपात्मजे । ब्रूहि यत्ते मनोदुःखं करिष्ये वचनं तव ॥
data.md: Rama said You are the same to me, O princess, as you are to Srinjaya; speak out the grief you have in your mind, I shall act up to your words.

data.v: भगवञ्शरणं त्वाद्य प्रपन्नास्मि महाव्रत । शोकपङ्कार्णवाद्घोरादुद्धरस्व च मां विभो ॥
data.md: Amba said My lord, I be take myself now to your refuge for you are of great vows, Tell me, my lord, who am fallen into the mire of grief and liberate me from the heavy calamity.

data.v: तस्याश्च दृष्ट्वा रूपं च वयश्चाभिनवं पुनः । सौकुमार्यं परं चैव रामश्चिन्तापरोऽभवत् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Seeing her beauty and again her youthful person and her extreme delicacy of mold, Rama became engaged in deep thought.

data.v: किमियं वक्ष्यतीत्येवं विमृशन्भृगुसत्तमः । इति दध्यौ चिरं रामः कृपयाभिपरिप्लुतः ॥
data.md: "What shall this one say?" So thought Bhrigu; thinking thus Rama was silent for a long time filled with pity.

data.v: कथ्यतामिति सा भूयो रामेणोक्ता शुचिस्मिता । सर्वमेव यथातत्त्वं कथयामास भार्गवे ॥
data.md: The lady, of sweet smiles being again asked to recite her story, said everything as had happened to him of Bhrigu's race.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा जामदग्न्यस्तु राजपुत्र्या वचस्तदा । उवाच तां वरारोहां निश्चित्यार्थविनिश्चयम् ॥
data.md: The son of Jamadagni too hearing those words of the princess first settled as to what he should do and then said to her of beautiful hips.

data.v: प्रेषयिष्यामि भीष्माय कुरुश्रेष्ठाय भामिनि । करिष्यति वचो धर्म्यं श्रुत्वा मे स नराधिपः ॥
data.md: Rama said O beautiful lady, I shall send words to that foremost among the Kurus, Bhishma, and that ruler among men. Hearing them will do, my bidding.

data.v: न चेत्करिष्यति वचो मयोक्तं जाह्नवीसुतः । धक्ष्याम्येनं रणे भद्रे सामात्यं शस्त्रतेजसा ॥
data.md: If the son of Jahnavi does not do what I say then shall I consume him in battle, O gentle lady, along with his ministers, by the blaze of my weapons.

data.v: उद्यतेषुमथो दृष्ट्वा ब्राह्मणं क्षत्रबन्धुवत् । यो हन्यात्समरे क्रुद्धो युध्यन्तमपलायिनम् । ब्रह्महत्या न तस्य स्यादिति धर्मेषु निश्चयः ॥
data.md: One, who seeing a Brahmana, ready to fight like a friend of the Kshatriyas, wrathfully slays him who flies not from the fled,

data.v: क्षत्रियाणां स्थितो धर्मे क्षत्रियोऽस्मि तपोधन । यो यथा वर्तते यस्मिंस्तथा तस्मिन्प्रवर्तयन् । नाधर्मं समवाप्नोति नरः श्रेयश्च विन्दति ॥
data.md: Such a one as myself who treats such according to his merit does not act unrighteously and does not come by evils.

data.v: अर्थे वा यदि वा धर्मे समर्थो देशकालवित् । अनर्थसंशयापन्नः श्रेयान्निःसंशयेन च ॥
data.md: When one, able to discriminate the propriety of time and place and knowing both virtue and worldly good, is doubtful of his course, he should without hesitation do that which is virtuous.

data.v: यस्मात्संशयितेऽर्थेऽस्मिन्यथान्यायं प्रवर्तसे । तस्माद्योत्स्यामि सहितस्त्वया राम महाहवे । पश्य मे बाहुवीर्यं च विक्रमं चातिमानुषम् ॥
data.md: Since you act unrighteously towards me in a matter connected with profit, I shall certainly fight with you in a great battle.

data.v: एवं गतेऽपि तु मया यच्छक्यं भृगुनन्दन । तत्करिष्ये कुरुक्षेत्रे योत्स्ये विप्र त्वया सह । द्वंद्वे राम यथेष्टं ते सज्जो भव महामुने ॥
data.md: I shall do what I can and O regenerate one, I shall fight with you in Kurukshetra; and since you are desirous to fight, be prepared for battle.

data.v: तत्र त्वं निहतो राम मया शरशताचितः । लप्स्यसे निर्जिताँल्लोकाञ्शस्त्रपूतो महारणे ॥
data.md: Go, O you who are fond of war, and return to the field of Kurukshetra and I shall go there to fight with you, O you whose only wealth is devotion.

data.v: स गच्छ विनिवर्तस्व कुरुक्षेत्रं रणप्रिय । तत्रैष्यामि महाबाहो युद्धाय त्वां तपोधन ॥
data.md: Being slain by a hundred arrows shot by me, you will obtain those regions earned by your asceticism, being sanctified by my weapons in the battle.

data.v: अपि यत्र त्वया राम कृतं शौचं पुरा पितुः । तत्राहमपि हत्वा त्वां शौचं कर्तास्मि भार्गव ॥
data.md: Where in days of days of old, you sanctified the name of your fathers, even there shall I sanctify you, O you of Bhrigu's race.

data.v: तत्र गच्छस्व राम त्वं त्वरितं युद्धदुर्मद । व्यपनेष्यामि ते दर्पं पौराणं ब्राह्मणब्रुव ॥
data.md: Therefore come there quickly, O you who are hard to vanquish in battle and I shall destroy your boast of days of old, which is even now referred to by Brahmanas,

data.v: यच्चापि कत्थसे राम बहुशः परिषत्सु वै । निर्जिताः क्षत्रिया लोके मयैकेनेति तच्छृणु ॥
data.md: The boast that you have indulged in for a long time past, namely the entire body of Kshatriyas have been conquered by me alone, listen to the cause thereof.

data.v: न तदा जायते भीष्मो मद्विधः क्षत्रियोऽपि वा । यस्ते युद्धमयं दर्पं कामं च व्यपनाशयेत् ॥
सोऽहं जातो महाबाहो भीष्मः परपुरंजयः । व्यपनेष्यामि ते दर्पं युद्धे राम न संशयः ॥
data.md: He, who will remove your boasts of velour and desire for war, is now born. He is myself, Bhishma, the subjugator of hostile cities and I shall destroy your pride in battle. There is no doubt about it.

data.v: ततो मामब्रवीद्रामः प्रहसन्निव भारत । दिष्ट्या भीष्म मया सार्धं योद्धुमिच्छसि संगरे ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Then did Rama say to me with a laugh, O Bharata:-It is fortunate, O Bhishma that you want to fight with me in battle.

data.v: अयं गच्छामि कौरव्य कुरुक्षेत्रं त्वया सह । भाषितं तत्करिष्यामि तत्रागच्छेः परंतप ॥
data.md: Being slain by a hundred arrows shot by me, you will obtain those regions earned by your asceticism, being sanctified by my weapons in the battle.

data.v: तत्र त्वां निहतं माता मया शरशताचितम् । जाह्नवी पश्यतां भीष्म गृध्रकङ्कबडाशनम् ॥
data.md: There will your mother Jahnavi see yourself slain by my hundred arrows, O Bhishma, and be made the food of vultures and other birds of prey.

data.v: कृपणं त्वामभिप्रेक्ष्य सिद्धचारणसेविता । मया विनिहतं देवी रोदतामद्य पार्थिव ॥
data.md: O ruler of the earth, let your mothe worshipped by Siddhas and Charanas seeing yourself slain by me, weep today.

data.v: अतदर्हा महाभागा भगीरथसुता नदी । या त्वामजीजनन्मन्दं युद्धकामुकमातुरम् ॥
data.md: Your mother of great parts, the daughter of Bhagiratha that gave birth to you, fool that you are, and affected by the desire of fight, is however undeserving of such a sight.

data.v: एहि गच्छ मया भीष्म युद्धमद्यैव वर्तताम् । गृहाण सर्वं कौरव्य रथादि भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Come and let us go together, O Bhishma, who are hard to vanquish in battle and desirous of war; take, O son of Kuru, your chariots etc. O foremost among the Bharatas,

data.v: इति ब्रुवाणं तमहं रामं परपुरंजयम् । प्रणम्य शिरसा राजन्नेवमस्त्वित्यथाब्रुवम् ॥
data.md: To Rama the conquered of enemies towns who thus said then I bowed my head and said "Be it so."

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा ययौ रामः कुरुक्षेत्रं युयुत्सया । प्रविश्य नगरं चाहं सत्यवत्यै न्यवेदयम् ॥
data.md: Rama, saying this, went to Kurukshetra with the desire of war and I too entering the city submitted every thing to Satyavati.

data.v: ततः कृतस्वस्त्ययनो मात्रा प्रत्यभिनन्दितः । द्विजातीन्वाच्य पुण्याहं स्वस्ति चैव महाद्युते ॥
data.md: Then after performing propitiatory rites and being blessed by my mother and asking the twice born to bless me,

data.v: रथमास्थाय रुचिरं राजतं पाण्डुरैर्हयैः । सूपस्करं स्वधिष्ठानं वैयाघ्रपरिवारणम् ॥
data.md: I mounted a beautiful chariot made of silver and drawn by white horses, beautiful to look at, furnished with good seats, and covered with tiger skins.

data.v: उपपन्नं महाशस्त्रैः सर्वोपकरणान्वितम् । तत्कुलीनेन वीरेण हयशास्त्रविदा नृप ॥
data.md: It was also furnished with great weapons and all other necessary things and guided by a charioteer of good birth well versed in the art of the management of horses,

data.v: युक्तं सूतेन शिष्टेन बहुशो दृष्टकर्मणा । दंशितः पाण्डुरेणाहं कवचेन वपुष्मता ॥
data.md: Careful and well trained in battle and who had seen many deeds of bravery. I too, with my body covered with a white coat of mail,

data.v: पाण्डुरं कार्मुकं गृह्य प्रायां भरतसत्तम । पाण्डुरेणातपत्रेण ध्रियमाणेन मूर्धनि ॥
data.md: And taking a white bow, went out, O best among the Bharatas with a white umbrella held over my head.

data.v: पाण्डुरैश्चामरैश्चापि वीज्यमानो नराधिप । शुक्लवासाः सितोष्णीषः सर्वशुक्लविभूषणः ॥
data.md: I was also fanned by white fans, O ruler of men. I was clad with white garments, white head dress and all my ornaments were white.

data.v: स्तूयमानो जयाशीर्भिर्निष्क्रम्य गजसाह्वयात् । कुरुक्षेत्रं रणक्षेत्रमुपायां भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: I went out of the city called after the elephant, being eulogized with prayers for my victory and approached the site of battle namely Kurukshetra.

data.v: ते हयाश्चोदितास्तेन सूतेन परमाहवे । अवहन्मां भृशं राजन्मनोमारुतरंहसः ॥
data.md: Those horses fleet as the mind or the wind, urged by that charioteer, took me, O king, to the great battle.

data.v: गत्वाहं तत्कुरुक्षेत्रं स च रामः प्रतापवान् । युद्धाय सहसा राजन्पराक्रान्तौ परस्परम् ॥
data.md: Myself as also that Rama endued with luster having reached Kurukshetra was each desirous of showing our prowess.

data.v: ततः संदर्शनेऽतिष्ठं रामस्यातितपस्विनः । प्रगृह्य शङ्खप्रवरं ततः प्राधममुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Coming within the sight of that excellent ascetic Rama, I took my good conch and loudly blew it.

data.v: ततस्तत्र द्विजा राजंस्तापसाश्च वनौकसः । अपश्यन्त रणं दिव्यं देवाः सर्षिगणास्तदा ॥
data.md: At the time, O king, there were ascetics and other dwellers of the forest as well as groups of gods with Indra at their head to see that fight.

data.v: ततो दिव्यानि माल्यानि प्रादुरासन्मुहुर्मुहुः । वादित्राणि च दिव्यानि मेघवृन्दानि चैव ह ॥
data.md: There were seen at the time divine garlands and divine music and masses of clouds.

data.v: ततस्ते तापसाः सर्वे भार्गवस्यानुयायिनः । प्रेक्षकाः समपद्यन्त परिवार्य रणाजिरम् ॥
data.md: Then did all the devotees, the followers of the scion of Bhrigu's race, become the spectators and surround us.

data.v: ततो मामब्रवीद्देवी सर्वभूतहितैषिणी । माता स्वरूपिणी राजन्किमिदं ते चिकीर्षितम् ॥
data.md: Then did my divine mother, doing good to all creatures, in her own form say to me, O king, "what is this desired by you?

data.v: गत्वाहं जामदग्न्यं तं प्रयाचिष्ये कुरूद्वह । भीष्मेण सह मा योत्सीः शिष्येणेति पुनः पुनः ॥
data.md: O supporter of the Kuru race, going to the son of Jamadagni I shall beg of him again and again saying: Do not fight with Bhishma.

data.v: मा मैवं पुत्र निर्बन्धं कुरु विप्रेण पार्थिव । जामदग्न्येन समरे योद्धुमित्यवभर्त्सयत् ॥
data.md: Do not, my son fight thus with a Brahmana, O ruler of the earth, do not fight with the son of Jamadagni;" it was thus that she reproved me.

data.v: किं न वै क्षत्रियहरो हरतुल्यपराक्रमः । विदितः पुत्र रामस्ते यतस्त्वं योद्धुमिच्छसि ॥
data.md: He has strength similar to that of Hara and he is the exterminator of the Kshatriya race, Rama with whom you desire to fight is well known to you.

data.v: ततोऽहमब्रुवं देवीमभिवाद्य कृताञ्जलिः । सर्वं तद्भरतश्रेष्ठ यथावृत्तं स्वयंवरे ॥
data.md: Then did I say to that goddess after bowing to her and clasping my hands all that had happened in the election of husband, O foremost among the Bharatas.

data.v: यथा च रामो राजेन्द्र मया पूर्वं प्रसादितः । काशिराजसुतायाश्च यथा कामः पुरातनः ॥
data.md: I told her also the way Rama had been spoken to by me, O chief among kings, and the old doings of the daughter of the king of the Kashis.

data.v: ततः सा राममभ्येत्य जननी मे महानदी । मदर्थं तमृषिं देवी क्षमयामास भार्गवम् । भीष्मेण सह मा योत्सीः शिष्येणेति वचोऽब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Then my mother, the great river, going to Rama and trying to entreat that Rishi, that scion of Bhrigu's race for my sake,

data.v: स च तामाह याचन्तीं भीष्ममेव निवर्तय । न हि मे कुरुते काममित्यहं तमुपागमम् ॥
data.md: Said these words: “Do not fight with Bhishma for he is your pupil” and he too said to her who was beseeching him. “Turn back the purpose of Bhishma. I am here because he does not perform what I desire."

data.v: ततो गङ्गा सुतस्नेहाद्भीष्मं पुनरुपागमत् । न चास्याः सोऽकरोद्वाक्यं क्रोधपर्याकुलेक्षणः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Then did Ganga, out of affection for her son, come again to Bhishma but he with eyes expanded with wrath did not attend to her words.

data.v: अथादृश्यत धर्मात्मा भृगुश्रेष्ठो महातपाः । आह्वयामास च पुनर्युद्धाय द्विजसत्तमः ॥
data.md: Then did the great devotee of virtuous soul, the foremost of the race of Bhrigu present himself to his view and that best among the twice born summoned him to fight.

data.v: तमहं स्मयन्निव रणे प्रत्यभाषं व्यवस्थितम् । भूमिष्ठं नोत्सहे योद्धुं भवन्तं रथमास्थितः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Laughingly I said to him who stood there for battle: Myself riding on a chariot I do not venture to fight with you who are on the ground.

data.v: आरोह स्यन्दनं वीर कवचं च महाभुज । बधान समरे राम यदि योद्धुं मयेच्छसि ॥
data.md: Mount on a chariot, O hero, and adjust your coat of mail, O you of long arms if, O Rama, you desire to fight with me.

data.v: ततो मामब्रवीद्रामः स्मयमानो रणाजिरे । रथो मे मेदिनी भीष्म वाहा वेदाः सदश्ववत् ॥
data.md: Then did Rama say to me laughingly in the field of battle: "The earth is chariot, O Bhishma, and the Vedas carry me like good horses.

data.v: सूतो मे मातरिश्वा वै कवचं वेदमातरः । सुसंवीतो रणे ताभिर्योत्स्येऽहं कुरुनन्दन ॥
data.md: The wind is my driver, and the mothers of the Vedas (Gayatri, Savitri and Sarasvati) constitute my coat of mail. Well protected by these, in battle, I shall fight, O you delighter of the Kurus."

data.v: एवं ब्रुवाणो गान्धारे रामो मां सत्यविक्रमः । शरव्रातेन महता सर्वतः पर्यवारयत् ॥
data.md: Saying thus, O son of Gandhari, Rama of true prowess covered me on all sides with a thick shower of arrows.

data.v: ततोऽपश्यं जामदग्न्यं रथे दिव्ये व्यवस्थितम् । सर्वायुधधरे श्रीमत्यद्भुतोपमदर्शने ॥
data.md: Then did I see the son of Jamadagni seated on a car holding all the principal weapons, endued with beauty and appearing wonderful to the sight.

data.v: मनसा विहिते पुण्ये विस्तीर्णे नगरोपमे । दिव्याश्वयुजि संनद्धे काञ्चनेन विभूषिते ॥
data.md: The car was created by his will force and was like a holy and spacious city with celestial horses yoked to it and well protected and ornamented with gold.

data.v: ध्वजेन च महाबाहो सोमालंकृतलक्ष्मणा । धनुर्धरो बद्धतूणो बद्धगोधाङ्गुलित्रवान् ॥
data.md: He was also clad in a coat of mail, O you of long arms, looking like the sun and moon, wielding a bow furnished with a quiver and with his fingers protected by gloves.

data.v: सारथ्यं कृतवांस्तत्र युयुत्सोरकृतव्रणः । सखा वेदविदत्यन्तं दयितो भार्गवस्य ह ॥
data.md: Akritavrana, desirous of fighting, performed the office of the charioteer in that battle. He was the dear friend of that descendant Bhrigu and very well versed in Vedas.

data.v: आह्वयानः स मां युद्धे मनो हर्षयतीव मे । पुनः पुनरभिक्रोशन्नभियाहीति भार्गवः ॥
data.md: When he challenged me to fight my heart was very much pleased. The descendant of Bhrigu said to me again and again "come, come.”

data.v: तमादित्यमिवोद्यन्तमनाधृष्यं महाबलम् । क्षत्रियान्तकरं राममेकमेकः समासदम् ॥
data.md: Then did I approach him who was blazing like the sun, incapable of being vanquished and endued with great strength. Alone I approached Rama, the exterminator of the Kshatriya race.

data.v: ततोऽहं बाणपातेषु त्रिषु वाहान्निगृह्य वै । अवतीर्य धनुर्न्यस्य पदातिरृषिसत्तमम् ॥
data.md: After receiving three showers of arrows I stopped my horses and dismounting and putting aside my bow, I went on foot to that best among the Rishis.

data.v: अभ्यगच्छं तदा राममर्चिष्यन्द्विजसत्तमम् । अभिवाद्य चैनं विधिवदब्रुवं वाक्यमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: And coming before him I worshipped Rama the best among the twice born and after saluting him addressed him suitably in these excellent words.

data.v: योत्स्ये त्वया रणे राम विशिष्टेनाधिकेन च । गुरुणा धर्मशीलेन जयमाशास्स्व मे विभो ॥
data.md: Whether you are equal to me or superior I shall fight with you, my lord, though you are my virtuous preceptor. Bless me that I may obtain victory.

data.v: एवमेतत्कुरुश्रेष्ठ कर्तव्यं भूतिमिच्छता । धर्मो ह्येष महाबाहो विशिष्टैः सह युध्यताम् ॥
data.md: Rama said O foremost among the Kurus, such should be done by one who desires prosperity. It is virtuous, O you of long arms, to fight with those that are well known.

data.v: शपेयं त्वां न चेदेवमागच्छेथा विशां पते । युध्यस्व त्वं रणे यत्तो धैर्यमालम्ब्य कौरव ॥
data.md: If, O lord of the universe, you had not thus come to me I would have cursed you; fight you in battle with patience, O son of Kuru.

data.v: न तु ते जयमाशासे त्वां हि जेतुमहं स्थितः । गच्छ युध्यस्व धर्मेण प्रीतोऽस्मि चरितेन ते ॥
data.md: I cannot bless you for victory, for I myself am standing here to vanquish you Go, fight fairly, I am pleased with your conduct.

data.v: ततोऽहं तं नमस्कृत्य रथमारुह्य सत्वरः । प्राध्मापयं रणे शङ्खं पुनर्हेमविभूषितम् ॥
data.md: Then did I, after saluting him, quickly mount my chariot and again blew loudly my conch in the field of battle, a conch set with gold.

data.v: ततो युद्धं समभवन्मम तस्य च भारत । दिवसान्सुबहून्राजन्परस्परजिगीषया ॥
data.md: Then did the fight take place between myself and him, O Bharata for a great many days, O king, during which each was desirous of vanquishing the other.

data.v: स मे तस्मिन्रणे पूर्वं प्राहरत्कङ्कपत्रिभिः । षष्ट्या शतैश्च नवभिः शराणामग्निवर्चसाम् ॥
data.md: In the battle, he first struck me with straight arrows with wings of vulture to the number of six hundred and nine.

data.md: By that shower, my four horses as also my chariot, O lord of the universe, completely covered; but clad in a coat of mail, I myself remained calm.

data.v: आचार्यता मानिता मे निर्मर्यादे ह्यपि त्वयि । भूयस्तु शृणु मे ब्रह्मन्संपदं धर्मसंग्रहे ॥
data.md: I have shown sufficient respect to yourself as a preceptor, though you have paid little regard to me. Listen again, O Brahmana, to what should be done if you want to acquire virtue.

data.v: ये ते वेदाः शरीरस्था ब्राह्मण्यं यच्च ते महत् । तपश्च सुमहत्तप्तं न तेभ्यः प्रहराम्यहम् ॥
data.md: The Vedas that are in your body and the great spirit of Brahma that is there and the great asceticism practiced by you, I do not strike at.

data.v: प्रहरे क्षत्रधर्मस्य यं त्वं राम समास्थितः । ब्राह्मणः क्षत्रियत्वं हि याति शस्त्रसमुद्यमात् ॥
data.md: I shall strike at your Kshatriya-hood since, O Rama, you have adopted the life of a Kshatriya; a Brahmana becomes a Kshatriya owing to his taking up arms.

data.v: पश्य मे धनुषो वीर्यं पश्य बाह्वोर्बलं च मे । एष ते कार्मुकं वीर द्विधा कुर्मि ससायकम् ॥
data.md: Behold now the strength of my bow; and behold the might of my arms. O hero, I shall cut asunder this bow of yours by my arrows.

data.v: तस्याहं निशितं भल्लं प्राहिण्वं भरतर्षभ । तेनास्य धनुषः कोटिश्छिन्ना भूमिमथागमत् ॥
data.md: Then did I hurl towards him a broad headed arrow and by it his bow broke into a million pieces and fell to the ground.

data.v: नव चापि पृषत्कानां शतानि नतपर्वणाम् । प्राहिण्वं कङ्कपत्राणां जामदग्न्यरथं प्रति ॥
data.md: In the same way, I shot a hundred arrows furnished with the wings of a vulture on the son of Jamadagni.

data.v: हेमन्तान्तेऽशोक इव रक्तस्तबकमण्डितः । बभौ रामस्तदा राजन्क्वचित्किंशुकसंनिभः ॥
data.md: He looked like the Ashoka tree, at the end of winter, covered with bunches of red flowers or, O king, like the Kinshuka tree when laden with flowers.

data.v: ततोऽन्यद्धनुरादाय रामः क्रोधसमन्वितः । हेमपुङ्खान्सुनिशिताञ्शरांस्तान्हि ववर्ष सः ॥

data.md: Those fierce arrows, which were like flames and poisonous serpents coming from several sides, caused me to tremble at their great force and pierced my very vitals.

data.md: Then did I, with wrath, shoot on Rama arrows, hundred in number after summoning all my patience and addressing myself to battle.

data.md: Then did I at once again and again cut them asunder, O king, by my hundred and thousands of arrows, when they were still in the air.

data.md: In this way did I ward off the heavenly weapons of Rama and the energetic Rama too, that chastiser of enemies, conversant with celestial weapons, thwarted off the weapons of mine.

data.md: There did that best among the twice-born, Rama, the son of Jamadagni, suddenly turning to the right, pierce me in my breast.

data.md: Then did I foremost among the Bharatas, faint on that best of cars. My charioteer quickly removed who deprived of consciousness.

data.v: ततो मामपयातं वै भृशं विद्धमचेतसम् । रामस्यानुचरा हृष्टाः सर्वे दृष्ट्वा प्रचुक्रुशुः । अकृतव्रणप्रभृतयः काशिकन्या च भारत ॥

data.md: My consciousness (after a time) having come back I said to my charioteer "O charioteer go where Rama is, I am prepared (for battle) for I have now no pains.”

data.v: ततो मामवहत्सूतो हयैः परमशोभितैः । नृत्यद्भिरिव कौरव्य मारुतप्रतिमैर्गतौ ॥
data.md: Then did the charioteer bear me by means of exceedingly beautiful horses which went on dancing as it were, O scion of the Kuru race, and which were of the speed similar of that of the wind.

data.md: Having then come near Rama and being wrathful I shot forth a shower of arrows, O Kaurava, with the desire of gaining victory over that wrathful one.

data.v: तानापतत एवासौ रामो बाणानजिह्मगान् । बाणैरेवाच्छिनत्तूर्णमेकैकं त्रिभिराहवे ॥
data.md: But that Rama cut asunder those arrows which went along in straight lines, when they were in still in the air, by shooting three arrows for each of mine.

data.md: Then did I shoot at Rama, the son of Jamadgna with the desire of killing him, blazing arrows of good appearance, guided by death itself.

data.md: Shikhandin said O you of good vows, I will return to you your manhood, O God. Only for a certain period bear by womanhood, O night ranger.

data.v: प्रतिप्रयाते दाशार्णे पार्थिवे हेमवर्मणि । कन्यैवाहं भविष्यामि पुरुषस्त्वं भविष्यसि ॥
data.md: On the departure of the Dashara king, who is known as the golden-armoured heroes, I will become a woman, and you will become a man.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा समयं तत्र चक्राते तावुभौ नृप । अन्योन्यस्यानभिद्रोहे तौ संक्रामयतां ततः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Having spoken thus, they two made an agreement O king, and they transferred to each other their (respective) sexes.

data.v: स्त्रीलिङ्गं धारयामास स्थूणो यक्षो नराधिप । यक्षरूपं च तद्दीप्तं शिखण्डी प्रत्यपद्यत ॥
data.md: The Yaksha Sthuna took upon himself (her) maidenhood, O Bharata, and Shikhandin obtained the blazing form of the Yaksha.

data.v: ततः शिखण्डी पाञ्चाल्यः पुंस्त्वमासाद्य पार्थिव । विवेश नगरं हृष्टः पितरं च समासदत् । यथावृत्तं तु तत्सर्वमाचख्यौ द्रुपदस्य च ॥
data.md: Thereupon Shikhandin, the Panchalya, having obtained manhood, O king, entered the city and went to his father with great joy.

data.v: द्रुपदस्तस्य तच्छ्रुत्वा हर्षमाहारयत्परम् । सभार्यस्तच्च सस्मार महेश्वरवचस्तदा ॥
ततः संप्रेषयामास दशार्णाधिपतेर्नृप । पुरुषोऽयं मम सुतः श्रद्धत्तां मे भवानिति ॥
data.md: "This offspring is a male. May you believe this." At length the Dasharnaka king suddenly approached,

data.v: अथ दाशार्णको राजा सहसाभ्यागमत्तदा । पाञ्चालराजं द्रुपदं दुःखामर्षसमन्वितः ॥
ततः काम्पिल्यमासाद्य दशार्णाधिपतिस्तदा । प्रेषयामास सत्कृत्य दूतं ब्रह्मविदां वरम् ॥
ब्रूहि मद्वचनाद्दूत पाञ्चाल्यं तं नृपाधमम् । यद्वै कन्यां स्वकन्यार्थे वृतवानसि दुर्मते । फलं तस्यावलेपस्य द्रक्ष्यस्यद्य न संशयः ॥
data.md: That as you selected my daughter for your daughter, O wicked one, so you will see the fruit of that insult very soon, no doubt,

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु तेनासौ ब्राह्मणो राजसत्तम । दूतः प्रयातो नगरं दाशार्णनृपचोदितः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, that Brahmana messenger, dispatched by that Dasharna king, traveled towards the city, O best of kings.

data.v: तत आसादयामास पुरोधा द्रुपदं पुरे । तस्मै पाञ्चालको राजा गामर्घ्यं च सुसत्कृतम् । प्रापयामास राजेन्द्र सह तेन शिखण्डिना ॥
data.md: That priest then arrived at the city of Drupada. And to him, the Panchala king paid all homage by offering a cow and the Arghya (a mixture of honey, milk &c paid as a homage on one's arrival at a house).

data.v: तां पूजां नाभ्यनन्दत्स वाक्यं चेदमुवाच ह । यदुक्तं तेन वीरेण राज्ञा काञ्चनवर्मणा ॥
यत्तेऽहमधमाचार दुहित्रर्थेऽस्मि वञ्चितः । तस्य पापस्य करणात्फलं प्राप्नुहि दुर्मते ॥
देहि युद्धं नरपते ममाद्य रणमूर्धनि । उद्धरिष्यामि ते सद्यः सामात्यसुतबान्धवम् ॥
तदुपालम्भसंयुक्तं श्रावितः किल पार्थिवः । दशार्णपतिदूतेन मन्त्रिमध्ये पुरोधसा ॥
अब्रवीद्भरतश्रेष्ठ द्रुपदः प्रणयानतः । यदाह मां भवान्ब्रह्मन्संबन्धिवचनाद्वचः । तस्योत्तरं प्रतिवचो दूत एव वदिष्यति ॥
data.md: What you have spoken, O Brahmana, according to the words of my kinsman (son's father-in-law) receive its reply, my messenger will give the answer to the king.

data.v: ततः संप्रेषयामास द्रुपदोऽपि महात्मने । हिरण्यवर्मणे दूतं ब्राह्मणं वेदपारगम् ॥
data.md: King Drupada then despatched a Brahmana messenger, versed in all the Vedas to the high-souled golden armored one.

data.v: समागम्य तु राज्ञा स दशार्णपतिना तदा । तद्वाक्यमाददे राजन्यदुक्तं द्रुपदेन ह ॥
data.md: Approaching the king, viz., the lord of the Dasharna land he gave the reply, O king, as it had been spoken, O king, by Drupada.

data.v: आगमः क्रियतां व्यक्तं कुमारो वै सुतो मम । मिथ्यैतदुक्तं केनापि तन्न श्रद्धेयमित्युत ॥
data.md: Make an enquiry and let this be made clear that this prince, is my son. You have been misinformation by some body; but this is surely unworthy of belief

data.v: ततः स राजा द्रुपदस्य श्रुत्वा; विमर्शयुक्तो युवतीर्वरिष्ठाः । संप्रेषयामास सुचारुरूपाः; शिखण्डिनं स्त्री पुमान्वेति वेत्तुम् ॥
data.md: Thereupon that king, hearing (the words) of the Drupada, became dejected, and sent some choice, youthful ladies of great beauty to Shikhandin to ascertain whether he was a man or a woman.

data.v: ताः प्रेषितास्तत्त्वभावं विदित्वा; प्रीत्या राज्ञे तच्छशंसुर्हि सर्वम् । शिखण्डिनं पुरुषं कौरवेन्द्र; दशार्णराजाय महानुभावम् ॥
data.md: Those ladies, who had been despatched, having learnt the truth, praised all about Shikhandin who was a man of great strength, O best of Kuru's race, to the king of the Dasharna country.

data.v: ततः कृत्वा तु राजा स आगमं प्रीतिमानथ । संबन्धिना समागम्य हृष्टो वासमुवास ह ॥
data.md: Having made this test, the king gladdened at heart, going up to his kinsman (his daughter's father-in-law) lived with him (some time) with gladness.

data.v: शिखण्डिने च मुदितः प्रादाद्वित्तं जनेश्वरः । हस्तिनोऽश्वांश्च गाश्चैव दास्यो बहुशतास्तथा । पूजितश्च प्रतिययौ निवर्त्य तनयां किल ॥
data.md: And that lord of men gave away with joy to Shikhandin great wealth, and elephants, horses and cattle and slaves also in large numbers.

data.v: विनीतकिल्बिषे प्रीते हेमवर्मणि पार्थिवे । प्रतियाते तु दाशार्णे हृष्टरूपा शिखण्डिनी ॥
कस्यचित्त्वथ कालस्य कुबेरो नरवाहनः । लोकानुयात्रां कुर्वाणः स्थूणस्यागान्निवेशनम् ॥
data.md: Had made his departure, Shikhandin was filled with joy for some time. After the lapse of a certain period, Kubera, who had been for his bearers, making a journey through the earth, came to the abode of Sthuna.

data.v: स तद्गृहस्योपरि वर्तमान; आलोकयामास धनाधिगोप्ता । स्थूणस्य यक्षस्य निशाम्य वेश्म; स्वलंकृतं माल्यगुणैर्विचित्रम् ॥
data.md: Moving to and fro over his abode, the protector of all wealth observed that the mansion of the Yaksha Sthuna was beautifully adorned with devise sorts of garlands;

data.v: लाजैश्च गन्धैश्च तथा वितानै;रभ्यर्चितं धूपनधूपितं च । ध्वजैः पताकाभिरलंकृतं च; भक्ष्यान्नपेयामिषदत्तहोमम् ॥
data.md: And with fragrant roots (of plants) and scented with the smoke of sweet incense, and ornamented with banners and well supplied with food and drink.

data.v: तत्स्थानं तस्य दृष्ट्वा तु सर्वतः समलंकृतम् । अथाब्रवीद्यक्षपतिस्तान्यक्षाननुगांस्तदा ॥
data.md: Seeing that spot of his, ornamented in every way, and (everywhere filled with garlands of gems and precious stones and gold,

data.v: स्वलंकृतमिदं वेश्म स्थूणस्यामितविक्रमाः । नोपसर्पति मां चापि कस्मादद्य सुमन्दधीः ॥
data.md: This mansion of Sthuna is well-adorned, O you (followers) of immeasurable powers. Why does not this fool, however, approach me?

data.v: यस्माज्जानन्सुमन्दात्मा मामसौ नोपसर्पति । तस्मात्तस्मै महादण्डो धार्यः स्यादिति मे मतिः ॥
data.md: As this fool does not approach me, though knowing (that I am here), therefore he should be inflicted on a severe punishment. This is what I think.

data.v: द्रुपदस्य सुता राजन्राज्ञो जाता शिखण्डिनी । तस्यै निमित्ते कस्मिंश्चित्प्रादात्पुरुषलक्षणम् ॥
data.md: The Yakshas said Oking, a daughter was born to king Drupada, by name Shikhandin. For her sake, on some account, he has given away his manhood.

data.v: अग्रहील्लक्षणं स्त्रीणां स्त्रीभूतस्तिष्ठते गृहे । नोपसर्पति तेनासौ सव्रीडः स्त्रीस्वरूपवान् ॥
data.md: Having taken her womanhood (on himself) he remains in this abode, being a woman. He does not approach (you), bashful on account of her holding the form of a woman.

data.v: एतस्मात्कारणाद्राजन्स्थूणो न त्वाद्य पश्यति । श्रुत्वा कुरु यथान्यायं विमानमिह तिष्ठताम् ॥
data.md: It is for this reason, O king, that Sthuna does not approach you today. Having (now) heard (this) do as it seems proper. “Let the car be stopped here."

data.v: आनीयतां स्थूण इति ततो यक्षाधिपोऽब्रवीत् । कर्तास्मि निग्रहं तस्येत्युवाच स पुनः पुनः ॥
data.md: "Let Sthuna be brought, I shall inflict punishment on him." Said thus the lord of the Yakshas again and again.

data.v: सोऽभ्यगच्छत यक्षेन्द्रमाहूतः पृथिवीपते । स्त्रीस्वरूपो महाराज तस्थौ व्रीडासमन्वितः ॥
data.md: Being summoned, O lord of the earth, he came before the king of the Yakshas; and O great king, having the form of a female, he stood bashfully.

data.v: तं शशाप सुसंक्रुद्धो धनदः कुरुनन्दन । एवमेव भवत्वस्य स्त्रीत्वं पापस्य गुह्यकाः ॥
data.md: Then the giver of wealth crushed him in his anger, O descendant of Kuru's race, “even never thus let the womanhood of this sinful one remain, O Guhyakas!"

data.v: ततोऽब्रवीद्यक्षपतिर्महात्मा; यस्माददास्त्ववमन्येह यक्षान् । शिखण्डिने लक्षणं पापबुद्धे; स्त्रीलक्षणं चाग्रहीः पापकर्मन् ॥
data.md: And then that high-souled lord of Yakshas (again) said, “As you have humiliated all Yakshas by giving away your own sex of Shikhandin, O you of sinful understanding and by taking her female sex, O you of sinful deeds,"

data.v: अप्रवृत्तं सुदुर्बुद्धे यस्मादेतत्कृतं त्वया । तस्मादद्य प्रभृत्येव त्वं स्त्री स पुरुषस्तथा ॥
data.md: As you have perpetrated this, you of evil understanding, which had been attempted by any one (before this), so from this day forth you shall remain a woman, and she a man.

data.v: ततः प्रसादयामासुर्यक्षा वैश्रवणं किल । स्थूणस्यार्थे कुरुष्वान्तं शापस्येति पुनः पुनः ॥
data.md: The Yakshas then began to appease (the anger of) Vaishravana, for the sake of Sthuna Karna, (saying) "set a limit to your course" again and again.

data.v: ततो महात्मा यक्षेन्द्रः प्रत्युवाचानुगामिनः । सर्वान्यक्षगणांस्तात शापस्यान्तचिकीर्षया ॥
data.md: Then that high-souled lord of the Yakshas, o son, answered his followers, all those Yakshas, with the desire of setting a limit to (his) curse.

data.v: हते शिखण्डिनि रणे स्वरूपं प्रतिपत्स्यते । स्थूणो यक्षो निरुद्वेगो भवत्विति महामनाः ॥
data.md: On the death of Shikhandin 0 you Yakshas of high minds, he shall regain his own form. Therefore let the Yaksha Sthuna be free from anxiety.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा भगवान्देवो यक्षराक्षसपूजितः । प्रययौ सह तैः सर्वैर्निमेषान्तरचारिभिः ॥
data.md: Having thus spoken, that mighty god, king of the Yakshas, departed well honored, with all those followers, who traveled (a great distance) in a moment.

data.v: स्थूणस्तु शापं संप्राप्य तत्रैव न्यवसत्तदा । समये चागमत्तं वै शिखण्डी स क्षपाचरम् ॥
data.md: Sthuna, having received this curse, he stayed there. In due time Shikhandin came to that Rakshasa.

data.v: सोऽभिगम्याब्रवीद्वाक्यं प्राप्तोऽस्मि भगवन्निति । तमब्रवीत्ततः स्थूणः प्रीतोऽस्मीति पुनः पुनः ॥
data.md: Approaching him, he said these words” I am come to you) O god. “Thereupon Sthuna said to him again and again, I am pleased (with you).”

data.v: आर्जवेनागतं दृष्ट्वा राजपुत्रं शिखण्डिनम् । सर्वमेव यथावृत्तमाचचक्षे शिखण्डिने ॥
data.md: Seeing that prince Shikhandin come to him without guile, he related to Shikhandin everything as it had happened.

data.v: शप्तो वैश्रवणेनास्मि त्वत्कृते पार्थिवात्मज । गच्छेदानीं यथाकामं चर लोकान्यथासुखम् ॥
data.md: The Yaksha said It is not your fault, O princess, that I have (thus) been crushed by Vaishravana (but of my own destiny). Depart now according to your pleasure, and live with all happiness on this earth.

data.v: दिष्टमेतत्पुरा मन्ये न शक्यमतिवर्तितुम् । गमनं तव चेतो हि पौलस्त्यस्य च दर्शनम् ॥
data.md: It is my belief that it was ordained before hand, and is incapable of being altered, viz., his coming here and my seeing Paulastya (the god of wealth).

data.v: एवमुक्तः शिखण्डी तु स्थूणयक्षेण भारत । प्रत्याजगाम नगरं हर्षेण महतान्वितः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Thus addressed by the Yaksha Sthuna o Bharata, Shikhandin went back to the city filled with great joy.

data.v: पूजयामास विविधैर्गन्धमाल्यैर्महाधनैः । द्विजातीन्देवताश्चापि चैत्यानथ चतुष्पथान् ॥
data.md: he And worshipped with great sumptuousness and with scents and garlands of all sorts, all those of the twice-born, and the gods and the (sacred) trees and cross-ways.

data.v: द्रुपदः सह पुत्रेण सिद्धार्थेन शिखण्डिना । मुदं च परमां लेभे पाञ्चाल्यः सह बान्धवैः ॥
data.md: And Drupada, the king of Panchalas, became exceedingly joyful, with his son Shikhandin who had obtained his desire and as well as with his friends.

data.v: शिष्यार्थं प्रददौ चापि द्रोणाय कुरुपुंगव । शिखण्डिनं महाराज पुत्रं स्त्रीपूर्विणं तथा ॥
data.md: And then he gave away to Drona as a disciple, O best of the race, his son Shikhandin, who had been before (this) a daughter, O king.

data.v: प्रतिपेदे चतुष्पादं धनुर्वेदं नृपात्मजः । शिखण्डी सह युष्माभिर्धृष्टद्युम्नश्च पार्षतः ॥
data.md: And the king's son, Shikhandin, obtained (the knowledge) of the science of arms with its four divisions (receiving, holding, using, and baffling weapons), as also yourselves and Dhrishtadyumna of Prishata's race.

data.v: मम त्वेतच्चरास्तात यथावत्प्रत्यवेदयन् । जडान्धबधिराकारा ये युक्ता द्रुपदे मया ॥
data.md: To me however, my spies who had been set on Drupada by me, (in the guise of) being idiots, who were blind and deaf, related all things as they happened, O son.

data.v: एवमेष महाराज स्त्रीपुमान्द्रुपदात्मजः । संभूतः कौरवश्रेष्ठ शिखण्डी रथसत्तमः ॥
data.md: In this way it is, O great king, that the son of Drupada is both a man and woman, and he was born as Shikhandin, O best of Kurus, and as the best of car-warriors.

data.v: ज्येष्ठा काशिपतेः कन्या अम्बा नामेति विश्रुता । द्रुपदस्य कुले जाता शिखण्डी भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: (Thus it happened), 0 best among Bharata's race, that the eldest daughter of the king of Kashi, known by the name of Amba, is born in the family of Drupada as Shikhandin.

data.v: कृतवर्मा सहानीकस्त्रिगर्ताश्च महाबलाः । दुर्योधनश्च नृपतिर्भ्रातृभिः परिवारितः ॥
data.md: Then (came) Kritavarman with his forces, and the great car-warrior Trigarta, and king Duryodhana, surrounded by his brothers.

data.v: शलो भूरिश्रवाः शल्यः कौसल्योऽथ बृहद्बलः । एते पश्चादवर्तन्त धार्तराष्ट्रपुरोगमाः ॥
data.md: And Shalya and Brihadratha the monarch of the Kausalya, marched in the rear, led by the sons of Dhritarashtra.

data.v: ते समेन पथा यात्वा योत्स्यमाना महारथाः । कुरुक्षेत्रस्य पश्चार्धे व्यवतिष्ठन्त दंशिताः ॥
data.md: And these followers of the great and mighty son of Dhritarashtra, uniting together according to the proper mode took up their station, all clad in Armour, on the back part of the plains of Kurukshetra.

data.v: दुर्योधनस्तु शिबिरं कारयामास भारत । यथैव हास्तिनपुरं द्वितीयं समलंकृतम् ॥
data.md: And Duryodhana caused his camp to be so made, O Bharata, as to look like a second Hastinapur, well-ornamented.

data.v: न विशेषं विजानन्ति पुरस्य शिबिरस्य वा । कुशला अपि राजेन्द्र नरा नगरवासिनः ॥
data.md: And, O great king, even the clever men who lived in the city could not detect any distinguishing feature if their encampment from the city.

data.v: तादृशान्येव दुर्गाणि राज्ञामपि महीपतिः । कारयामास कौरव्यः शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: And the descendant of Kuru, a lord of the earth, caused camps similar to this, inaccessible (to others). to be made, by hundreds and thousands, for the kings.

data.v: पञ्चयोजनमुत्सृज्य मण्डलं तद्रणाजिरम् । सेनानिवेशास्ते राजन्नाविशञ्शतसंघशः ॥
data.md: That encampment of war stood on a circular area of five Yojanas. And into them,O king, he made soldiers with their horses &c., enter in groups of hundreds.

data.v: तत्र ते पृथिवीपाला यथोत्साहं यथाबलम् । विविशुः शिबिराण्याशु द्रव्यवन्ति सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: Therein those rulers of earth entered, according to their respective strength and prowess, in camps which abounded in things by thousands.

data.v: तेषां दुर्योधनो राजा ससैन्यानां महात्मनाम् । व्यादिदेश सबाह्यानां भक्ष्यभोज्यमनुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: And king Duryodhana ordered provisions of the best kind for high-souled (warriors) with their forces, consisting of infantry.

data.v: सगजाश्वमनुष्याणां ये च शिल्पोपजीविनः । ये चान्येऽनुगतास्तत्र सूतमागधबन्दिनः ॥
data.md: And elephants, horses and other men. Those who lived by mechanical arts and those who followed them there as bards, singers and panegyrists.

data.v: वणिजो गणिका वारा ये चैव प्रेक्षका जनाः । सर्वांस्तान्कौरवो राजा विधिवत्प्रत्यवैक्षत ॥
data.md: And merchants and prostitutes and spies, and those who came as sight-seers, the Kuru king looked into (the needs of) all of them, with all proper care.

data.v: तथैव राजा कौन्तेयो धर्मपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः । धृष्टद्युम्नमुखान्वीरांश्चोदयामास भारत ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said In the same way the virtuous king Yudhishthira, son of Kunti, urged the warriors headed by Dhrishtadyumna, O Bharata.

data.v: चेदिकाशिकरूषाणां नेतारं दृढविक्रमम् । सेनापतिममित्रघ्नं धृष्टकेतुमथादिशत् ॥
data.md: He ordered the leaders and commander of the Chedis, Kashis, and Karushas, Dhrishtaketu, of steady prowess, and the slayer of foes,

data.v: विराटं द्रुपदं चैव युयुधानं शिखण्डिनम् । पाञ्चाल्यौ च महेष्वासौ युधामन्यूत्तमौजसौ ॥
data.md: And Virata, and Drupada and Yuyudhana and Shikhandin, and the mighty archers, rulers of Panchalas, the two Yudhamanyu and Uttamaujas (to advance).

data.v: ते शूराश्चित्रवर्माणस्तप्तकुण्डलधारिणः । आज्यावसिक्ता ज्वलिता धिष्ण्येष्विव हुताशनाः । अशोभन्त महेष्वासा ग्रहाः प्रज्वलिता इव ॥
data.md: Those warriors, clad in variegated armours, and bearing golden ear-rings shone like clarified butter is poured (or them).

data.v: सोऽथ सैन्यं यथायोगं पूजयित्वा नरर्षभः । दिदेश तान्यनीकानि प्रयाणाय महीपतिः ॥
अभिमन्युं बृहन्तं च द्रौपदेयांश्च सर्वशः । धृष्टद्युम्नमुखानेतान्प्राहिणोत्पाण्डुनन्दनः ॥
data.md: And the son of Pandu ordered Abhimanyu and Brihanta and all Draupadeyas, (the five sons of Draupadi), headed by Dhrishtadyumna, to advance.

data.v: भीमं च युयुधानं च पाण्डवं च धनंजयम् । द्वितीयं प्रेषयामास बलस्कन्धं युधिष्ठिरः ॥
data.md: And then he sent forth the second division of the army with Bhima, Yuyudhana and Dhananjaya, the son of Pandu.

data.v: भाण्डं समारोपयतां चरतां संप्रधावताम् । हृष्टानां तत्र योधानां शब्दो दिवमिवास्पृशत् ॥
data.md: And the noise of the warriors as they put on the equipment's of war, and moved and ran about, cheered as they were, reached the very heavens.

data.v: स्वयमेव ततः पश्चाद्विराटद्रुपदान्वितः । तथान्यैः पृथिवीपालैः सह प्रायान्महीपतिः ॥
data.md: Last of all, that ruler of the earth himself went forth in the rear, with other rulers of the earth, accompanied by Virata and Drupada.

data.v: भीमधन्वायनी सेना धृष्टद्युम्नपुरस्कृता । गङ्गेव पूर्णा स्तिमिता स्यन्दमाना व्यदृश्यत ॥
data.md: Then that army, of terrible archers commanded by Dhrishtadyumna, as it moved to and fro, looked like the full Ganga, silently rushing on.

data.v: ततः पुनरनीकानि व्ययोजयत बुद्धिमान् । मोहयन्धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्राणां बुद्धिनिस्रवम् ॥
data.md: Then the intelligent (Yudhishthira) again arranged his troops (in a different order), confounding the knowledge of the sons of Dhritarashtra.

data.v: द्रौपदेयान्महेष्वासानभिमन्युं च पाण्डवः । नकुलं सहदेवं च सर्वांश्चैव प्रभद्रकान् ॥
दश चाश्वसहस्राणि द्विसाहस्रं च दन्तिनः । अयुतं च पदातीनां रथाः पञ्चशतास्तथा ॥
भीमसेनं च दुर्धर्षं प्रथमं प्रादिशद्बलम् । मध्यमे तु विराटं च जयत्सेनं च मागधम् ॥
महारथौ च पाञ्चाल्यौ युधामन्यूत्तमौजसौ । वीर्यवन्तौ महात्मानौ गदाकार्मुकधारिणौ । अन्वयातां ततो मध्ये वासुदेवधनंजयौ ॥
data.md: And the two Maharathas, the ruler of Panchala, Yudhamanyu and Uttamaujas, who were high-souled (warriors) of great prowess holding clubs and bows.

data.v: बभूवुरतिसंरब्धाः कृतप्रहरणा नराः । तेषां विंशतिसाहस्रा ध्वजाः शूरैरधिष्ठिताः ॥
पञ्च नागसहस्राणि रथवंशाश्च सर्वशः । पदातयश्च ये शूराः कार्मुकासिगदाधराः । सहस्रशोऽन्वयुः पश्चादग्रतश्च सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: Those warriors who composed the infantry, armed with bows, swords, and maces, followed by thousands in the vanguard, and thousands in the rear.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरो यत्र सैन्ये स्वयमेव बलार्णवे । तत्र ते पृथिवीपाला भूयिष्ठं पर्यवस्थिताः ॥
data.md: And in that part of that ocean of forces, where Yudhishthira himself (was), stationed a large number of rulers of the earth.

data.v: तत्र नागसहस्राणि हयानामयुतानि च । तथा रथसहस्राणि पदातीनां च भारत । यदाश्रित्याभियुयुधे धार्तराष्ट्रं सुयोधनम् ॥
data.md: And in that part (were) thousands of elephants, and ten thousands of steeds, as well as thousands of cars and foot-soldiers O Bharata.

data.v: ततोऽन्ये शतशः पश्चात्सहस्रायुतशो नराः । नदन्तः प्रययुस्तेषामनीकानि सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: And above these, other men, by hundreds and thousands and tens of thousands of groups o thousands, followed their (sons of Pandu) forces, roaring loudly.

data.v: तत्र भेरीसहस्राणि शङ्खानामयुतानि च । वादयन्ति स्म संहृष्टाः सहस्रायुतशो नराः ॥
data.md: And those men by thousands and tens of thousand, filled with joy, beat their drums by thousands, and blew their conches by tens of thousands.

data.v: कथं युयुधिरे वीराः कुरुपाण्डवसोमकाः । पार्थिवाश्च महाभागा नानादेशसमागताः ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said How did those great warriors, the Kurus, the Pandavas and the Somakas and the other illustrious kings who assembled from various countries fight?

data.v: यथा युयुधिरे वीराः कुरुपाण्डवसोमकाः । कुरुक्षेत्रे तपःक्षेत्रे शृणु तत्पृथिवीपते ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said ruler of carth, hear how those great warriors, the Kurus, the Pandavas and the Somakas foughton the holy field of Kurukshetra.

data.v: अवतीर्य कुरुक्षेत्रं पाण्डवाः सहसोमकाः । कौरवानभ्यवर्तन्त जिगीषन्तो महाबलाः ॥
data.md: Arriving at Kurukshetra, the powerful Pandavas, accompanied with the Somakas, advanced against the Kurus with the desire of victory.

data.v: वेदाध्ययनसंपन्नाः सर्वे युद्धाभिनन्दिनः । आशंसन्तो जयं युद्धे वधं वाभिमुखा रणे ॥
data.md: Learned in the Vedas, they all took great delight in battle. Being eager to secure success in the battle, they with their soldiers advanced to the fight.

data.v: अभियाय च दुर्धर्षां धार्तराष्ट्रस्य वाहिनीम् । प्राङ्मुखाः पश्चिमे भागे न्यविशन्त ससैनिकाः ॥
data.md: Coming near the army of Dhritarashtra's son those invincible heroes encamped with their troops on the Western part (of the field), their faces turned towards the East.

data.v: समन्तपञ्चकाद्बाह्यं शिबिराणि सहस्रशः । कारयामास विधिवत्कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः ॥
data.md: The son of Kunti Yudhishthira ordered tents to be pitched duly be thousands beyond the region called Samantapanchaka.

data.v: शून्येव पृथिवी सर्वा बालवृद्धावशेषिता । निरश्वपुरुषा चासीद्रथकुञ्जरवर्जिता ॥
data.md: The whole earth appeared to be empty, having been destitute of men and horses, and of chariots and elephants. Only the children and the old remained (in their houses).

data.v: यावत्तपति सूर्यो हि जम्बूद्वीपस्य मण्डलम् । तावदेव समावृत्तं बलं पार्थिवसत्तम ॥
data.md: O foremost of kings, from all parts of Jambudvipa over which the sun shines was collected that great force.

data.v: एकस्थाः सर्ववर्णास्ते मण्डलं बहुयोजनम् । पर्याक्रामन्त देशांश्च नदीः शैलान्वनानि च ॥
data.md: Men of all races assembled there, and they occupied an area extending many Yojanas over fields, rivers, hills and woods.

data.v: तेषां युधिष्ठिरो राजा सर्वेषां पुरुषर्षभ । आदिदेश सवाहानां भक्ष्यभोज्यमनुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: That foremost of men, king Yudhishthira ordered to be supplied to them in excellent edibles and other things of enjoyment.

data.v: संज्ञाश्च विविधास्तास्तास्तेषां चक्रे युधिष्ठिरः । एवंवादी वेदितव्यः पाण्डवेयोऽयमित्युत ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira fixed various appellation so that by uttering them they might be known to others that they belong to the Pandava force.

data.v: अभिज्ञानानि सर्वेषां संज्ञाश्चाभरणानि च । योजयामास कौरव्यो युद्धकाल उपस्थिते ॥
data.md: That Kuru prince also fixed names and emblems for all of them, so that they might be recognised at the time of battle.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा ध्वजाग्रं पार्थानां धार्तराष्ट्रो महामनाः । सह सर्वैर्महीपालैः प्रत्यव्यूहत पाण्डवान् ॥
data.md: Seeing (from a distance) the top of the flatstaff of Pritha's son, the illustrious son of Dhritarashtra with a white umbrella held over his head stood surrounded by his one hundred brothers in the midst of a thousand elephants and began with all the kings to array his troops against the Pandavas.

data.v: पाण्डुरेणातपत्रेण ध्रियमाणेन मूर्धनि । मध्ये नागसहस्रस्य भ्रातृभिः परिवारितम् ॥
data.md: Seeing (from a distance) the top of the flatstaff of Pritha's son, the illustrious son of Dhritarashtra with a white umbrella held over his head stood surrounded by his one hundred brothers in the midst of a thousand elephants and began with all the kings to array his troops against the Pandavas.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा दुर्योधनं हृष्टाः सर्वे पाण्डवसैनिकाः । दध्मुः सर्वे महाशङ्खान्भेरीर्जघ्नुः सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: Seeing the Duryodhana, the Panchalas, who ever liked fighting, were filled with delight, They blew their loud-sounding conchs and sweet sounding cymbals.

data.v: ततः प्रहृष्टां स्वां सेनामभिवीक्ष्याथ पाण्डवाः । बभूवुर्हृष्टमनसो वासुदेवश्च वीर्यवान् ॥
data.md: Seeing the (Panchala) troops in great delight, the Pandavas and the greatly effulgent Vasudeva (Krishna) were filled with joy.

data.v: ततो योधान्हर्षयन्तौ वासुदेवधनंजयौ । दध्मतुः पुरुषव्याघ्रौ दिव्यौ शङ्खौ रथे स्थितौ ॥
data.md: Those lion of men, Vasudeva and Arjuna who were seated on one car felt the greatest joy and both blew their celestial conchs.

data.v: पाञ्चजन्यस्य निर्घोषं देवदत्तस्य चोभयोः । श्रुत्वा सवाहना योधाः शकृन्मूत्रं प्रसुस्रुवुः ॥
data.md: Having heard the loud sound of the conchs of those two heroes, the soldiers passed urine and excrete.

data.v: यथा सिंहस्य नदतः स्वनं श्रुत्वेतरे मृगाः । त्रसेयुस्तद्वदेवासीद्धार्तराष्ट्रबलं तदा ॥
data.md: As animals are afflicted with fear in hearing the voice of the roaring lion, so were that force on hearing those sounds.

data.v: उदतिष्ठद्रजो भौमं न प्राज्ञायत किंचन । अन्तर्धीयत चादित्यः सैन्येन रजसावृतः ॥
data.md: A fearful dust arose and every thing became invisible. The sun, becoming suddenly shrouded by it appeared as if it had set.

data.v: ववर्ष चात्र पर्जन्यो मांसशोणितवृष्टिमान् । व्युक्षन्सर्वाण्यनीकानि तदद्भुतमिवाभवत् ॥
data.md: A black clouds of flesh and blood showered a down pour over that vast assemblage of troops. Every thing appeared to be wonderful.

data.v: वायुस्ततः प्रादुरभून्नीचैः शर्करकर्षणः । विनिघ्नंस्तान्यनीकानि विधमंश्चैव तद्रजः ॥
data.md: A fearful wind blow carrying over the earth innumerable stones and afflicting thousands and thousands of soldiers.

data.v: उभे सेने तदा राजन्युद्धाय मुदिते भृशम् । कुरुक्षेत्रे स्थिते यत्ते सागरक्षुभितोपमे ॥
data.md: O king, both armies stood for battle in the field of Kurukshetra like two agitated oceans.

data.v: तयोस्तु सेनयोरासीदद्भुतः स समागमः । युगान्ते समनुप्राप्ते द्वयोः सागरयोरिव ॥
data.md: That great battle of the two enemies was exceedingly wonderful, like two oceans at the end of the Yuga.

data.v: शून्यासीत्पृथिवी सर्वा बालवृद्धावशेषिता । तेन सेनासमूहेन समानीतेन कौरवैः ॥
data.md: The whole earth was empty for only the children and the old remained in their houses, others having joined the Kuru armies.

data.v: ततस्ते समयं चक्रुः कुरुपाण्डवसोमकाः । धर्मांश्च स्थापयामासुर्युद्धानां भरतर्षभ ॥

मूषका स्तनबालाश्च सतियः पत्तिपञ्जकाः । आदिदायाः सिरालाश्च स्तूबका स्तनपास्तथा ॥
हृषीविदर्भाः कान्तीकास्तङ्गणाः परतङ्गणाः । उत्तराश्चापरे म्लेच्छा जना भरतसत्तम ॥
यवनाश्च सकाम्बोजा दारुणा म्लेच्छजातयः । सक्षद्द्रुहः कुन्तलाश्च हूणाः पारतकैः सह ॥
तथैव मरधाश्चीनास्तथैव दशमालिकाः । क्षत्रियोपनिवेशाश्च वैश्यशूद्रकुलानि च ॥
शूद्राभीराथ दरदाः काश्मीराः पशुभिः सह । खशिकाश्च तुखाराश्च पल्लवा गिरिगह्वराः ॥
आत्रेयाः सभरद्वाजास्तथैव स्तनयोषिकाः । औपकाश्च कलिङ्गाश्च किरातानां च जातयः ॥
तामरा हंसमार्गाश्च तथैव करभञ्जकाः । उद्देशमात्रेण मया देशाः संकीर्तिताः प्रभो ॥
यथागुणबलं चापि त्रिवर्गस्य महाफलम् । दुह्येद्धेनुः कामधुक्च भूमिः सम्यगनुष्ठिता ॥
data.md: O lord, I have briefly mentioned them. If the resources of the earth are properly developed, she is then like an all-yielding cow, from which the threefold objects of Dharma, Artha and Kama might be linked. Brave kings learned in Dharma and Artha have become covetous of earth.

data.v: तस्यां गृध्यन्ति राजानः शूरा धर्मार्थकोविदाः । ते त्यजन्त्याहवे प्राणान्रसागृद्धास्तरस्विनः ॥
देवमानुषकायानां कामं भूमिः परायणम् । अन्योन्यस्यावलुम्पन्ति सारमेया इवामिषम् ॥
राजानो भरतश्रेष्ठ भोक्तुकामा वसुंधराम् । न चापि तृप्तिः कामानां विद्यते चेह कस्यचित् ॥
तस्मात्परिग्रहे भूमेर्यतन्ते कुरुपाण्डवाः । साम्ना दानेन भेदेन दण्डेनैव च पार्थिव ॥
पिता माता च पुत्रश्च खं द्यौश्च नरपुंगव । भूमिर्भवति भूतानां सम्यगच्छिद्रदर्शिनी ॥
भारतस्यास्य वर्षस्य तथा हैमवतस्य च । प्रमाणमायुषः सूत फलं चापि शुभाशुभम् ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra said 0 Sanjaya, O Suta, tell me in detail the length of life, the strength, the good and bad things, the past, present and future of the dwellers of the Bharata Varsha and of the Himavat Varsha and also of Harivarsha.

data.v: अनागतमतिक्रान्तं वर्तमानं च संजय । आचक्ष्व मे विस्तरेण हरिवर्षं तथैव च ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra said 0 Sanjaya, O Suta, tell me in detail the length of life, the strength, the good and bad things, the past, present and future of the dwellers of the Bharata Varsha and of the Himavat Varsha and also of Harivarsha.

data.v: चत्वारि भारते वर्षे युगानि भरतर्षभ । कृतं त्रेता द्वापरं च पुष्यं च कुरुवर्धन ॥
data.md: Sanjaya said O best of the Bharata race, there are four Yugas in Bharatavarsha, namely Krita, Treta, Dvapara and Kali.

data.v: पूर्वं कृतयुगं नाम ततस्त्रेतायुगं विभो । संक्षेपाद्द्वापरस्याथ ततः पुष्यं प्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: The first of the Yugas in Krita. O lord, after the expire of the Krita comes Treta, after Treta comes Dvapara. after the last of all comes Kali.

data.v: चत्वारि च सहस्राणि वर्षाणां कुरुसत्तम । आयुःसंख्या कृतयुगे संख्याता राजसत्तम ॥
data.md: O foremost of the Kurus, O best of kings, the length of life in the Krita Yoga is four thousand years.

data.v: तथा त्रीणि सहस्राणि त्रेतायां मनुजाधिप । द्विसहस्रं द्वापरे तु शते तिष्ठति संप्रति ॥
data.md: O ruler of men, the length of life in Treta is three thousand. In the present age, in this Dvapara, persons remain on earth for two thousand years.

data.v: न प्रमाणस्थितिर्ह्यस्ति पुष्येऽस्मिन्भरतर्षभ । गर्भस्थाश्च म्रियन्तेऽत्र तथा जाता म्रियन्ति च ॥
data.md: O best of the Bharata race, in Kali there will be no fixed period for men's life on earth, they will die even in the womb or after birth.

data.v: महाबला महासत्त्वाः प्रजागुणसमन्विताः । अजायन्त कृते राजन्मुनयः सुतपोधनाः ॥
महोत्साहा महात्मानो धार्मिकाः सत्यवादिनः । जाताः कृतयुगे राजन्धनिनः प्रियदर्शनाः ॥
आयुष्मन्तो महावीरा धनुर्धरवरा युधि । जायन्ते क्षत्रियाः शूरास्त्रेतायां चक्रवर्तिनः ॥
data.md: In Treta age are born brave Kshatriyas who are subject to none who are long-lived, who are heroic, and who wield the bow in battle with great skill.

data.v: सर्ववर्णा महाराज जायन्ते द्वापरे सति । महोत्साहा महावीर्याः परस्परवधैषिणः ॥
data.md: O kings, when Dvapara comes in, all the four orders of men become capable of great exertions. They possess great energy and they desire to conquer one another.

data.v: तेजसाल्पेन संयुक्ताः क्रोधनाः पुरुषा नृप । लुब्धाश्चानृतकाश्चैव पुष्ये जायन्ति भारत ॥
data.md: O king, the men born in the Kali Yuga possess little energy. They become highly wrathful, covetous and untruthful.

data.v: ईर्ष्या मानस्तथा क्रोधो मायासूया तथैव च । पुष्ये भवन्ति मर्त्यानां रागो लोभश्च भारत ॥
data.md: Jealousy, pride, anger, deception, malice, covetousness, O descendant of Bharata, are the characteristics of men in the Kali age.

data.v: संक्षेपो वर्तते राजन्द्वापरेऽस्मिन्नराधिप । गुणोत्तरं हैमवतं हरिवर्षं ततः परम् ॥
data.md: O king, O ruler of men, the portion of the Dvapara Yuga that still remains is very small. The Varsha called Haimavat is superior to Harivarsha in all attributes.

data.v: जम्बूखण्डस्त्वया प्रोक्तो यथावदिह संजय । विष्कम्भमस्य प्रब्रूहि परिमाणं च तत्त्वतः ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra said O Sanjaya, you have described to me. Jambukhanda. Tell me now its dimensions and extent.

data.v: समुद्रस्य प्रमाणं च सम्यगच्छिद्रदर्शन । शाकद्वीपं च मे ब्रूहि कुशद्वीपं च संजय ॥
data.md: O Sanjaya, tell me also of the extent of the oceans, of Shakadvipa, and of Kushadvipa.

data.v: शाल्मलं चैव तत्त्वेन क्रौञ्चद्वीपं तथैव च । ब्रूहि गावल्गणे सर्वं राहोः सोमार्कयोस्तथा ॥
data.md: Of Shalmalidvipa and of Kraunchadvipa. O son of Gavalgani, tell me also of Rahu, Soma and Surya.

data.v: राजन्सुबहवो द्वीपा यैरिदं संततं जगत् । सप्त त्वहं प्रवक्ष्यामि चन्द्रादित्यौ ग्रहांस्तथा ॥
data.md: Sanjaya said O king, there are many islands in this earth. But I shall describe to you only seven islands and also the moon, and the sun and the planets.

data.v: अष्टादश सहस्राणि योजनानां विशां पते । षट्शतानि च पूर्णानि विष्कम्भो जम्बुपर्वतः ॥
data.md: O king, the Jambu mountain extends for full eighteen thousand and six hundred Yojanas.

data.v: लावणस्य समुद्रस्य विष्कम्भो द्विगुणः स्मृतः । नानाजनपदाकीर्णो मणिविद्रुमचित्रितः ॥
data.md: The extent of the salt sea is said to be double of it. this sea is covered with many kingdoms. It is adorned with gems and corals.

data.v: नैकधातुविचित्रैश्च पर्वतैरुपशोभितः । सिद्धचारणसंकीर्णः सागरः परिमण्डलः ॥
data.md: It is adorned with many mountains that are variegated with metals of various kinds. It is circular in form like a sea, and is thickly peopled by the Siddhas and the Charanas.

data.v: शाकद्वीपं च वक्ष्यामि यथावदिह पार्थिव । शृणु मे त्वं यथान्यायं ब्रुवतः कुरुनन्दन ॥
data.md: O descendant of Bharata. O scion of the Kuru race, I shall now speak to you in detail of Shakadvipa. Hear as I describe it.

data.v: जम्बूद्वीपप्रमाणेन द्विगुणः स नराधिप । विष्कम्भेण महाराज सागरोऽपि विभागशः । क्षीरोदो भरतश्रेष्ठ येन संपरिवारितः ॥
data.md: O that island is twice as large as the Jambudvipa. O king of kings, the ocean also is twice as large as that island.

data.v: तत्र पुण्या जनपदा न तत्र म्रियते जनः । कुत एव हि दुर्भिक्षं क्षमातेजोयुता हि ते ॥
शाकद्वीपस्य संक्षेपो यथावद्भरतर्षभ । उक्त एष महाराज किमन्यच्छ्रोतुमिच्छसि ॥
data.md: There is no famine there. The people all possess forgiveness and great prowess. O best of the Bharata race, I have briefly spoken to you about Shakadvipa. What else. O king, do you desire to hear.

data.v: शाकद्वीपस्य संक्षेपो यथावदिह संजय । उक्तस्त्वया महाभाग विस्तरं ब्रूहि तत्त्वतः ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra said You have briefly told me of Shakadvipa. O greatly wise one, tell me now everything in detail.

data.v: तथैव पर्वता राजन्सप्तात्र मणिभूषिताः । रत्नाकरास्तथा नद्यस्तेषां नामानि मे शृणु । अतीवगुणवत्सर्वं तत्र पुण्यं जनाधिप ॥
data.md: O king there are seven mountains in that island. They are decked with jewels and there are mines of gems and precious stones. There are many rivers in that island. Hear, as I tell you their names. O king, every thing there is charming and delightful. The first of those mountains is called Meru. It is the abode of the celestials, the Rishis and the Gandharvas.

data.v: देवर्षिगन्धर्वयुतः परमो मेरुरुच्यते । प्रागायतो महाराज मलयो नाम पर्वतः । यतो मेघाः प्रवर्तन्ते प्रभवन्ति च सर्वशः ॥
data.md: O king, the next mountains stretching castward is called the Malaya. It is there that the clouds are born, and it is from that place that they disperse on all sides.

data.v: ततः परेण कौरव्य जलधारो महागिरिः । यत्र नित्यमुपादत्ते वासवः परमं जलम् । यतो वर्षं प्रभवति वर्षाकाले जनेश्वर ॥
data.md: O descendant of Kuru, the next is the large mountain, called Jaladhara. From it, Indra daily takes water of the best quality.

data.v: उच्चैर्गिरी रैवतको यत्र नित्यं प्रतिष्ठितः । रेवती दिवि नक्षत्रं पितामहकृतो विधिः ॥
data.md: O ruler of men, it is from that water that we get showers in the rains. Next is the great mountain, called Raivataka over which has been permanently placed in the sky of constellation Rohini. This arrangement has been made by the Grandsire (Brahma) himself. O great king, on the north of this mountains is one called Syama.

data.v: उत्तरेण तु राजेन्द्र श्यामो नाम महागिरिः । यतः श्यामत्वमापन्नाः प्रजा जनपदेश्वर ॥
data.md: It is as bright as the newly risen clouds. It is high beautiful and bright. O king, as the colour of that mountain is black, all the people that live there are dark.

data.v: सुमहान्संशयो मेऽद्य प्रोक्तं संजय यत्त्वया । प्रजाः कथं सूतपुत्र संप्राप्ताः श्यामतामिह ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra said O Sanjaya, a great doubt has arisen in my mind. Why, O son of Suta, people of that country are dark?

data.v: सर्वेष्वेव महाप्राज्ञ द्वीपेषु कुरुनन्दन । गौरः कृष्णश्च वर्णौ द्वौ तयोर्वर्णान्तरं नृप ॥
data.md: Sanjaya said O great king, O descendant of Kuru in all islands men may be found who are fair and those who are dark and those also who are born by the mixture of the white and the black races.

data.v: श्यामो यस्मात्प्रवृत्तो वै तत्ते वक्ष्यामि भारत । आस्तेऽत्र भगवान्कृष्णस्तत्कान्त्या श्यामतां गतः ॥
data.md: But because the people are all dark there, that mountain is called the Dark mountain. O chief of the Kurus, next to this is the great mountain, called Durgashaila.

data.v: ततः परं कौरवेन्द्र दुर्गशैलो महोदयः । केसरी केसरयुतो यतो वातः प्रवायति ॥
तेषां योजनविष्कम्भो द्विगुणः प्रविभागशः । वर्षाणि तेषु कौरव्य संप्रोक्तानि मनीषिभिः ॥
महामेरुर्महाकाशो जलदः कुमुदोत्तरः । जलधारात्परो राजन्सुकुमार इति स्मृतः ॥
data.md: O descendant of Kuru it is said by the learned that there are seven Varshas in that island. The Varsha of Meru is called Mahakasha, that of the water-giver (Malaya) is called Kumudottara. That of Jaladhara is called that of Shyama, called Manikanchana.

data.v: रैवतस्य तु कौमारः श्यामस्य तु मणीचकः । केसरस्याथ मोदाकी परेण तु महापुमान् ॥
परिवार्य तु कौरव्य दैर्घ्यं ह्रस्वत्वमेव च । जम्बूद्वीपेन विख्यातस्तस्य मध्ये महाद्रुमः ॥
data.md: That of Kesara is called Modaki and that of the next mountain is called Mahapuman. In the midst of that island is a large tree called Shaka. In height and breadth that tree is equal to that of the Jambu tree in Jambudvipa. The people always worship that tree.

data.v: शाको नाम महाराज तस्य द्वीपस्य मध्यगः । तत्र पुण्या जनपदाः पूज्यते तत्र शंकरः ॥
तत्र गच्छन्ति सिद्धाश्च चारणा दैवतानि च । धार्मिकाश्च प्रजा राजंश्चत्वारोऽतीव भारत ॥
वर्णाः स्वकर्मनिरता न च स्तेनोऽत्र दृश्यते । दीर्घायुषो महाराज जरामृत्युविवर्जिताः ॥
data.md: O king, the people there are all virtuous, O descendant of Bharata, all the four orders of men there are engaged in their respective duties. There occurs not a case of theft.

data.v: प्रजास्तत्र विवर्धन्ते वर्षास्विव समुद्रगाः । नद्यः पुण्यजलास्तत्र गङ्गा च बहुधागतिः ॥
data.md: O king, being free from old age and death, and possessing long life, the people there grow like rivers in the rains.

data.v: सुकुमारी कुमारी च सीता कावेरका तथा । महानदी च कौरव्य तथा मणिजला नदी । इक्षुवर्धनिका चैव तथा भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: Mahanadi, the Manijala, Chakshuas, and the river Vardhanika, O descendant of Kuru, O best of the Bharata race.

data.v: ततः प्रवृत्ताः पुण्योदा नद्यः कुरुकुलोद्वह । सहस्राणां शतान्येव यतो वर्षति वासवः ॥
data.md: These and many other rivers by hundreds and thousands all full of sacred water are there. O perpetuator of the Kuru race, Vasava (Indra) draws water from them to shower as rain.

data.v: न तासां नामधेयानि परिमाणं तथैव च । शक्यते परिसंख्यातुं पुण्यास्ता हि सरिद्वराः ॥
data.md: It is impossible to mention the names and lengths of these rivers. All of them are the foremost of all rivers, and they are all sincleansing.

data.v: तत्र पुण्या जनपदाश्चत्वारो लोकसंमताः । मगाश्च मशकाश्चैव मानसा मन्दगास्तथा ॥
data.md: As every body has heard in the island of Shaka there are four sacred countries. They are the Mrigas, the Mashakas, the Manasas and the Mandagas.

data.v: मगा ब्राह्मणभूयिष्ठाः स्वकर्मनिरता नृप । मशकेषु तु राजन्या धार्मिकाः सर्वकामदाः ॥
data.md: The Mrigas are generally Brahmanas engaged in the duties of their own. Many virtuous Kshatriyas are among the Mashakas who grant every wish of the Brahmanas.

data.v: भयाद्रणादुपरतं मंस्यन्ते त्वां महारथाः । येषां च त्वं बहुमतो भूत्वा यास्यसि लाघवम् ॥
data.md: And all great car warriors will think that you abstain from the battle through fear. You will be lightly thought of by those who honoured you before.

data.v: अवाच्यवादांश्च बहून्वदिष्यन्ति तवाहिताः । निन्दन्तस्तव सामर्थ्यं ततो दुःखतरं नु किम् ॥
data.md: Decrying your power, your enemies will say things unutterable. What can be more painful than this!

data.v: हतो वा प्राप्स्यसि स्वर्गं जित्वा वा भोक्ष्यसे महीम् । तस्मादुत्तिष्ठ कौन्तेय युद्धाय कृतनिश्चयः ॥
data.md: If killed, you will attain to heaven; and if victorious, you will enjoy the whole world. Therefore, being resolved to fight, arise, O son of Kunti.

data.v: सुखदुःखे समे कृत्वा लाभालाभौ जयाजयौ । ततो युद्धाय युज्यस्व नैवं पापमवाप्स्यसि ॥
data.md: Considering pleasure and pain, gain and loss, victory and defeat, all the same, be ready for fight, and then, you will incur no sin.

data.v: एषा तेऽभिहिता सांख्ये बुद्धिर्योगे त्विमां शृणु । बुद्ध्या युक्तो यया पार्थ कर्मबन्धं प्रहास्यसि ॥
data.md: The knowledge now imparted to you is relating to Sankha (the mystery of knowing Self). Now listen to Yoga, (the mystery of living in Self, which, if well possessed, O Partha, cuts off Karmabandhana (the law of rebirths, resulting from the effects of actions).

data.v: नेहाभिक्रमनाशोऽस्ति प्रत्यवायो न विद्यते । स्वल्पमप्यस्य धर्मस्य त्रायते महतो भयात् ॥
data.md: In this (Yoga) even the first attempt is not fruitless; there are no obstacles in it. Even a little of this delivers one from the great danger (of worldly births).

data.v: व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धिरेकेह कुरुनन्दन । बहुशाखा ह्यनन्ताश्च बुद्धयोऽव्यवसायिनाम् ॥
data.md: In this, O son of Kuru, there is mind's but one state, consisting of firm devotion; whereas undevotional men's minds are many-branched and attached to endless pursuits.

data.v: यामिमां पुष्पितां वाचं प्रवदन्त्यविपश्चितः । वेदवादरताः पार्थ नान्यदस्तीति वादिनः ॥
data.md: Those that are not learned those that delight in the Vedas, those that say that there is nothing else, those that are found of worldly pleasures, those that regard heaven as the highest object for acquisition, say flowery words on the birth resulting from the fruits of actions, and on multifarious rites that promise to give wealth and enjoyments.

data.v: कामात्मानः स्वर्गपरा जन्मकर्मफलप्रदाम् । क्रियाविशेषबहुलां भोगैश्वर्यगतिं प्रति ॥
data.md: Those that are not learned those that delight in the Vedas, those that say that there is nothing else, those that are found of worldly pleasures, those that regard heaven as the highest object for acquisition, say flowery words on the birth resulting from the fruits of actions, and on multifarious rites that promise to give wealth and enjoyments.

data.v: भोगैश्वर्यप्रसक्तानां तयापहृतचेतसाम् । व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धिः समाधौ न विधीयते ॥
data.md: Devotional feelings never arise in those whose minds have been stolen by the words of the lovers of enjoyment and wealth.

data.v: त्रैगुण्यविषया वेदा निस्त्रैगुण्यो भवार्जुन । निर्द्वंद्वो नित्यसत्त्वस्थो निर्योगक्षेम आत्मवान् ॥
data.md: The Vedas, O Arjuna, relate of the three qualities. Be free from them, by being unaffected by the pairs of opposites i.e., (heat and cold; pain and pleasures); by preserving courage; by being free from anxiety for new acquisitions; or from anxiety for the protection of old ones; and by being self-possessed.

data.v: यावानर्थ उदपाने सर्वतः संप्लुतोदके । तावान्सर्वेषु वेदेषु ब्राह्मणस्य विजानतः ॥
data.md: The (water of the) small tank serves the same purposes as (that of) the great lake. Like the above, the Brahmana, learned in devotion, serves the same purposes as those of all the Vedas.

data.v: कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन । मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि ॥
data.md: Your concern is only with actions, never with their fruits. Let not the fruits of actions be your motive. (at the same time) let not your inclination be towards action.

data.v: योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनंजय । सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योः समो भूत्वा समत्वं योग उच्यते ॥
data.md: Casting off all attachments, considering success and non-success the same, O Dhananjaya, perform actions. Such equanimity is called Yoga.

data.v: दूरेण ह्यवरं कर्म बुद्धियोगाद्धनंजय । बुद्धौ शरणमन्विच्छ कृपणाः फलहेतवः ॥
data.md: Religious rites, O Dhananjaya, is far inferior to devotion; therefore take shelter in devotion. The men who look to the fruits of their actions are pitiable.

data.v: बुद्धियुक्तो जहातीह उभे सुकृतदुष्कृते । तस्माद्योगाय युज्यस्व योगः कर्मसु कौशलम् ॥
data.md: Devotional men do not see the difference between good and bad works in this world. Therefore apply yourself to devotion. Cleverness in action is devotion.

data.v: कर्मजं बुद्धियुक्ता हि फलं त्यक्त्वा मनीषिणः । जन्मबन्धविनिर्मुक्ताः पदं गच्छन्त्यनामयम् ॥
data.md: The wise, possessed of devotion, giving up the fruits of action and being freed from shackles of births, repair to the place where there is no unhappiness.

data.v: यदा ते मोहकलिलं बुद्धिर्व्यतितरिष्यति । तदा गन्तासि निर्वेदं श्रोतव्यस्य श्रुतस्य च ॥
data.md: When your understanding (mind) has gone beyond all delusion, then will you attain to the indifference to all that you have heard or will hear.

data.v: श्रुतिविप्रतिपन्ना ते यदा स्थास्यति निश्चला । समाधावचला बुद्धिस्तदा योगमवाप्स्यसि ॥
data.md: When your mind, confounded by (all) that you have heard, will stand firm in contemplation, then will you acquire devotion.

data.v: स्थितप्रज्ञस्य का भाषा समाधिस्थस्य केशव । स्थितधीः किं प्रभाषेत किमासीत व्रजेत किम् ॥
data.md: Arjuna said "What are the characteristics, O Keshava, of one whose mind is steady, and whose understanding is devotional? How does the man of steady-mind speak, how does he sit, how does he move?"

data.v: प्रजहाति यदा कामान्सर्वान्पार्थ मनोगतान् । आत्मन्येवात्मना तुष्टः स्थितप्रज्ञस्तदोच्यते ॥
data.md: The Great One said “When a man, O Partha, abandons all his mental desires, and becomes pleased in his self by his own self, is called one of Steady-mind.

data.v: दुःखेष्वनुद्विग्नमनाः सुखेषु विगतस्पृहः । वीतरागभयक्रोधः स्थितधीर्मुनिरुच्यते ॥
data.md: Who is not moved in misery, who has no cravings for pleasures, and who is freed from attachment, anger and fear, is called the Sage of Steady-Mind.

data.v: यः सर्वत्रानभिस्नेहस्तत्तत्प्राप्य शुभाशुभम् । नाभिनन्दति न द्वेष्टि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ॥
data.md: His mind is steady who has no attachment for any thing; and who neither feels exultation nor aversion on receiving either the good or the bad.

data.v: यदा संहरते चायं कूर्मोऽङ्गानीव सर्वशः । इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ॥
data.md: His mind is steady who withdraws all his senses from all the (worldly) objects of senses, as a tortoise withdraws his limbs.

data.v: विषया विनिवर्तन्ते निराहारस्य देहिनः । रसवर्जं रसोऽप्यस्य परं दृष्ट्वा निवर्तते ॥
data.md: The objects of senses draw from an abstinent person, but not so his passions. But the passions fly from him who has seen the Supreme.

data.v: यततो ह्यपि कौन्तेय पुरुषस्य विपश्चितः । इन्द्रियाणि प्रमाथीनि हरन्ति प्रसभं मनः ॥
data.md: The madly boisterous senses, O son of Kunti, steal by force the mind of even that wise man who is striving (for emancipation).

data.v: तानि सर्वाणि संयम्य युक्त आसीत मत्परः । वशे हि यस्येन्द्रियाणि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ॥
data.md: The man of Yoga solely depends upon Me, keeping all his senses under control. His mind is steady who has controlled his senses.

data.v: ध्यायतो विषयान्पुंसः सङ्गस्तेषूपजायते । सङ्गात्संजायते कामः कामात्क्रोधोऽभिजायते ॥
data.md: Pondering over worldly matters breeds attachment for them; from this attachment desire is produce; from desire anger is begot.
